main event: On April 19, 1958, a ground-radar observation was made by the USAF in the Atlantic Ocean off Virginia, reporting two fiery objects leaving long red trails and traveling together west toward the ocean view for 6 seconds.
interesting points: The observation was classified as 'probably meteors' in the conclusions.
The report originated from the USAF, indicating it was an official military observation.
The objects were described as fiery, leaving long red trails, which is unusual for typical meteor sightings.
The location of the observation was in the Atlantic Ocean off Virginia, suggesting a remote area away from civilian air traffic.
The length of the observation was only 6 seconds, indicating a brief but significant event.
sighted object: two fiery objects leaving long red trails
